title: Quiet Flows The Holy Ganges!
review: Leaving the mountains, the river  appeared serene and beautiful. It's banks carpeted with white sand and boulders of rocks carried by the swift current during the  torrid  summer months seemed enchanting! The rapids of upper Shivpuri gave away to a placid surface, small wirpools faded away swiftly, the winter Sun slowly melted the dews clinging to the leaves, a few seagulls flew over,  the hanging bridge of Muni Ki Reti over the horizon looked like the  mythical bow of Lord Rama. Standing  on the bank of  this  ancient river,  I  closed my eyes! The vision of  a brilliant sky  with whiffs of gentle clouds filled up my mind, the  majestic mountains standing quietly, cold  morning breeze rustling the  leaves,   the faint sound of the waves  crashing on the shore and  an echo of a sacred hymn floated across  the river bed. The  peace and the  tranquility of this holy land  struck a chord deep inside.  A sense of   timelessness and the eternal presence gradually engulfed you in a bliss. Life is beautiful. Random Musings. Muni Ki Reti, Rhishkesh.

title: Its the ancient one with beautiful view.
review: Ganges flowing looks very mesmerizing while standing on this bridge. 2 wheeler is allowed to cross the river as well.

title: One of the Best attractions in Rishikesh
review: It's a well made foot bridge. 2 wheelers do travel on this hanging bridge along with passersby. At night it is well lit and very attractive. Has a lot of eat outs and cafes along side.

title: Heritage Jhula of Rishikesh
review: Rishikesh and Laxmanjhula are inextricably linked. The hanging foot bridge joins the old and new part of the city over the ganges.

title: New experience
review: The Lakshman jhula is the best bridge of the Rishikesh which many people can hangout and reduce godfrey got fighters spirit of God.

title: Historical value
review: Nothing exceptionally remarkable about the place. May be one time visit for historical reasons - that's all!

title: A must see
review: A perfect place to watch all the passing traffic go by wether its a colorful indian family, a honking motorbike, or a scrolling cow, the monkey seems to be the one keeping an eye on you.

title: A cable stayed bridge with a good view of river below
review: Its a hanging bridge with steel ropes spanning across the river.

title: Amazing view of Ganga River !
review: If you plan to discover the city of yoga, you have to cross the Ganga from the Laxman Jhula Bridge !

title: Colors, sounds and movement!!!
review: Very unique place and unforgettable experience: cross the bridges, many times, and experience the adventure to see motorbikes, cows, monkeys and people all together and in a very fun and intense way. Unique experience!

title: Awesome view
review: It is a 450 feet longan iron suspension bridge situated in Rishikesh in Indian state of Uttarakhand.Lakshman Jhula is one of the most prominent landmarks at Rishikesh.It is made over river Ganges to cross the river and is a landmark ofRishikesh.

title: Disappointed
review: Nothing amazing about it as I have already seen this type of suspended bridges in my life so not much amazed about it, but some of my friends were amazed and got frightened as they have seen it for the first time and as you walk over the bridge you can experience the bridge is shaking but as I have already said if you have seen and experienced any suspended bridge then this is worth skipping

title: Iconic Bridge, can provide you a great view of Ganga at Rishikesh
review: Again, excessive crowded place. Bikes, Cows & Pedestrian all of them are allowed to use this bridge. Lack of maintenance creates chaos.

title: Just gotta see it.
review: Doesn't matter where you encounter anything about Laxman Jhula, it all comes back to this bridge.  A must experience.  Cows, motorcycles and lots of pedestrians.

title: View the Ganga flowing beneath
review: The hanging bridge is used by people in Rishikesh as a means to cross from one side of Ganga to the other, but it is more of a tourist attraction. People stand all over the jhoola to take photographs, disrupting movement and hence the constant honking by the people on bikes. It is quiet early in the morning and beautiful to view the Ganga flowing, mountains all around.

title: Hanging bridge and Nice view of Ganges
review: The night view of Laxman Jhula on the chilly dark night was beautiful. We spent around 15-20 minutes and walked back to the room.  During daylight, both Ram Jhula and Laxman Jhula was very crowded and took time to cross. Taking photographs amidst the crowd was also a challenge. But, the green coloured Ganges flowing beneath makes it most pleasant to see from a height. We spent around 10 minutes in Laxman Jhula.

title: Amazing bridge and a great view!
review: An amazing experience and one that anyone coming to Rishikesh must have on their 'to do list'. I visited here 10 years ago and the first thing that I noticed on my return is the bridge has had a new paintjob, proudly showing the Indian tri-colours... it now looks even more impressive. Another example of awesome British engineering from a bygone era.

title: Hanging Bridge
review: Its one of the most amazing experience and one must experience it will on walking on it.During day time its very much crowded as bikers are also allowed to cross the Ganga.Due to that pedestrains enjoy less while walking .Its been painted by Indian Tri colors.There are many cafes around it one can sit there and enjoy the view

title: serene place in rishikesh
review: located in rishikesh,uttarakhand is this famous bridge named after Lord Ram's Brother Laxman ,

title: Awesome food, less awesome ambience
review: perfect views, great experience, be ready to be pushed and pulled because its so crowded, two wheelers should not be allowed on the bridge

title: Very Crowded, Ram Jhoola is better.
review: While it does seem to be a highly popular destination, the crowds make a visit to this place unbearable. Would suggest the Ram Jhoola bridge as the crowds are better managed there.The view is good as one can see the Ganges gushing down .

title: Good view of Ganga river. Very crowded
review: Good view of Ganga river. Should ban 2 wheeler in the bridge during peak hours which is already crowded with people. They keep honking and spoil the serenity of this place.

title: A must do
review: The bridge itself is an experience. By night is beautifully lit. The bridge gets very busy around 5ish due to all the locals rushing to get temple. Bikes, people, animals all cross this bridge in droves. Be prepared if your white and a woman to expect lots of locals taking photos.

title: Small width bridge
review: If you wanna go to visit opposite site of river you  need to use this bridge by walking or scooter. There is a lot of monkeys and cows also.

title: Very crowded
review: Great view, very crowded and with two wheelers also being allowed on the bridge its difficult to walk freely.

title: Iconic to the area,
review: If you are visiting Rishikesh taking a walk-about, enjoy the scenery of the mother Ganga, while meandering across the Laxman Jhula suspension bridge.

title: Iconic bridge
review: So great to be here in this lovely place and feel the energy- no where more so or more iconic than the Laxman Jhula Bridge spanning the Ganges.  A beautiful view and intense experience.

title: whole world in one tiny place ...
review: people from the whole world , you can find here . solo traveler , group , family every type you can find here. beaches are full of music lovers , yoga freaks , photographers , some neardy book readers. restaurants are awesome , street food is amazing , hotels , lodges , guest houses from cheaper to higher range . being the witness of sunset from the ghats of laxman jhula must be in your bucket list.

title: Noisy beauty
review: Beautiful scenery and majestic view of the Ganges. My only irritation is the allowance of scooters on the bridge. The honking of horns echoing in the valley takes away from what should be a very peaceful experience. You should have to walk your scooter/motorbike across the bridge and not ride it.

title: Perfect Location
review: Lakshman Jhula, Rishikesh Overview. The Lakshman Jhula is a famous hanging bridge across the river Ganga that connects two villages.

title: One of the best historical and Spiritual place.
review: you will feel really very peaceful here once you will visit here.. its my own experience i realize surrounding of God.

title: Narrow
review: Very Narrow bridge with scooters and cows.local corporation must look for some alternate for scooters and cows, jam like conditions always on the bridge.

title: The lovely view of the Ganga from Laxman Jhula
review: One should visit laxman Jhula, its a nice place, but when u r with kids its difficult to walk this much from one side of laxman jhula to all the way to ram jhula and back. But a must place

title: Awesome View
review: The bridge made to connect two river banks which are being divided by the great GANGES loved the place as we get a awesome view of the Ganges too.

title: smaller than expected but nice
review: Nice view from there, the ganga is very large but don't expect the water to be clear:)

title: It's always crowded. Wake up early and it's free for you.
review: Unbelieveable, so many pedestrians (people and cows) and vehicles on this narrow bridge. And it was even much more crowded during Kanwar yatra (beginning of Aug), when people from all over the country came to Rishikesh wearing orange outfit. You could see long lines of orange color (Lord Shiva's color).

title: Cool
review: The bridge is very beautiful , with mountains surrounding the place but the main problem is that local people use to travel through that bridge only so one can't explore it properly

title: Awesome
review: This is a suspension bridge over the Ganges. One can cross by walking only. Motor cycles are causing trouble to the pedestrians. Local authority should take care of it.

title: pic perfect spot
review: the cantilever bridge is a famous spot for clicking pictures and now selfies. lot of temples, cafes, eateries close by.lovely place.

title: Beautiful Bridge, But need some Strict rules
review: View from Laxman Jhula is truly amazing. Walking around, or just watching itself is kind of pleasure itself. Now, no one can stop Holy cow, bull and monkeys looking to snatch food from people walk on Jhula...But motorbikes with a rider who's always in hurry and pilgrims who throw water bottles and trash over the Laxman Jhula on holy river Ganga, which is very clean compared to Varanasi....

title: Good Suspension Bridge on the Ganga
review: We were here at Noon on a very cloudy day. It is a good 10 minute walk from the parking area to the bridge on a steep but paved road. The 138M Span bridge at a height of 18M Mean Summer Water Level was constructed as a jeepable in 1930. Now it is open for Pedestrian an two-wheelers.

title: Just stupid: Motorbikes on small bridge?
review: This bridge is a mess: stupid people on motorbikes crossing the bridge and harassing tresspassers to move. Dangerous and not wise at all!

title: The majestic laxman Jhula bridge
review: This is an iconic bridge in Rishikesh  and lord laxman is said to have crossed this ganga river which flows underneath it on a jute rope. Very popular bridge and many films have been shot here including the sonu ki titu ki sweety's song

title: awesome
review: something good to visit when you go to haridwar one of the places to go in haridwar go after diwali if you want a cool and good season

title: excellent jhula bridge
review: very nice hanging bridge, we uploaded so many pics here, but municipal corporation must stop animals to enter at Jhula, even monkeys also moving hare and there on jhula which can be dangerous for pilgrimages.

title: Try to cross on the motorbike
review: Wow, this bridge has a feel!

title: Bridge that is like a Swing !
review: Laxman Jhula is bridge on Ganga river and is like a swing. You can witness scenic landscapes while walking on it.

title: Excellent Wire Bridge over Ganga
review: It was amazing to be at Laxman Jhula. Lots of people, cattles and biker crossing from the bridge.  Great view of Trambkeshwar Temple from the Bridge.  Taking Selfie is prohibited as the bridge is narrow and people stops the flow while taking selfies

title: Something lovely about crossing Maa Ganga
review: I'll be honest, I have a thing for bridges. I like crossing them and while on the face of it, the brigde itself isn't quite so remarkable, I find something welcoming about crossing the Ganges. On each side, you're met with shops, yoga studios and ashrams galore (and some very fine restaurants). Happy crossing!

title: hanging bridge
review: If you are fond of camping and river rafting, this is the best destination for you.For rafting,they(your agency) will take 8-10kms from risikesh above the river, will start rafting from there on the river ganga. It was as amzing experince.Camping in a mountain and spending night under the infinite stars are awsome experince.other places to visit in Risikesh are laxman jhula, Ram jhula hanging over bridge over river Ganga.

title: Near 100 years old bridge
review: This was constructed in British era, and considering it was built about 100 years back, it certainly is a wonderful piece of engineering. It is still being used by locals for two wheeler and pedestrian traffic. Clean waters of Ganga below and land  of religious importance (Tapovan) at back ground makes it more special. Do visit temples of shri Laxman ji, Vijay raghav mandir etc.

title: Best place for YOGA
review: Visited in the month of November 2017. Weather was cool and little chill. Rishikesh, with its stunning mountain setting in the holy town is a wonderfully spiritual place to do yoga. Places are open to visitors. A popular attraction is the week long international Yoga Festival that's held at the Rishikesh every March. Many Temples also performs Ganga Aarti every evening. Number of things to do there like trekking, adventure games, rafting and Yoga.

title: Nicely maintained but historic flavor missing
review: Had en early morning visit .Place was quiet . Well maintained. Ganga here is wide and clean. There ghats where one can take a holy dip. Reasonably clean place. Could not connect to the feelings of historical significance.

title: Chaotic !
review: Bikes are constant irritation !! They keep honking and make it a walk not really worth it. The administration should take steps to ban bikes/mopeds on this stretch.

title: holds the world up
review: oh this bridge. everything crosses the yamuna over this bridge. dogs and cats and monkeys and people and bikes and scooters and sadhus and rafters and children and couples in love and foreigners exploring and people honking trying to get their way and someone is screaming coz theres a jam at one end. this was the feeling at dussera. everyone stood there as the ravana was burning . chaotic. simply chaotic but oh what a view. you really have to go there to experience it.

title: ALWAYS A GOOD MEETING POINT AND VISTAS
review: Good place to hang, eat some good food, and meet friends. Good meeting point and great picture taking, make sure to be careful crossing the bridge as many monkeys, motorbikes, cows etc all share the bridge. It is comical at times.

title: Over-crowded.  Aggressive monkeys
review: The Zlaxsman Zjhula  ridge has the potent for being a wondrous thing,....BUT periodically it is over crowded with scooters, cows, people and aggressive monkeys looking for food.  People stop on the bridge for photos of the amazing Ganga below and of each other which is so lovely and yetblocks traffic flow.  Scooters speed across the bridge blaring their horns.  I was so glad when I moved to the other side so I no longer longer had to cross the bridge.  I actually saw a monkey attack someone who did not appear to be carrying food,

title: Its traffic is an attraction itself
review: Beautiful bridge, colorful. Good for photographing, specially at night. Motorbikes, monkeys, cows, people, tourists are very curious!! Good place to spend some time just observing!

title: Great
review: An architecture marvel as it holds 2 wheeler vehicles and well as normal pedestrians crossing it at the same time and still maintain it's integrity very well. Offers a wide view of river Ganges in all its glory.

title: Laxman jhulla
review: Laxman Jhulla (Swing) is actually a bridge over the Holy River ganga for crossing. Must Go place you can go by walk or by 2 Wheeler ( only Allowed) . If you stand in centre of the bridge,the  feeling is simply awesome.

title: Icon of the city
review: You can't say you have been to LJ without crossing this bridge. Here, everything happens; from cows crossing, motorcycle, monkeys, pilgrims and tourists. There are thousands of selfies to be taken and a lot of patience and awareness for the crossing traveler. Be careful with the monkeys. Do not eat, do not wear anything shiny and above all, do not provoke them. They can be aggressive. Upon crossing, depending on the direction you are going, if you to to the temple side, there is Shiva's statue, sugar cane machines for your drinks, bangle bracelet stores, (yeah all they sell is bracelets) and two major temples and many things to see and buy. When you cross on the other side, there are many restaurants and more vendors. You can also watch the rafters cross by.

title: wow
review: The history of this town is connected with the Laxman jhula bridge. There is a different thrill to cross this moving bridge full of crowds

title: very great place with good views
review: a very good bridge on river with great views. you can see rafting people. visit early morning will be great because after 9 it is much crowed

title: crowded
review: its very crowded during the day time plus the two wheeler creates nuisance . best time to go there is early in the morning with beautiful winds blowing

title: Must visit
review: This is a must visit site of Rishikesh, its a steel suspension bridge across the river ganga. Very popular with tourist, locals and all kinds of creatures. The bridge sways a bit but if you walk reasonably fast you will not feel it.

title: Built by the British during the 1930s it is a hanging bridge and very crowded with vehicles and tourists.
review: The bridge is narrow and very crowded during the weekends with tourists, vehicles and of course stray bulls and monkeys.

title: Gives a breath takiing view of river Ganga
review: laxman Jhula is the identity of Rishikesh City and a prme attraction too. Although it is just a suspension bridge but the the sorrounding view from the bridge is fantastic and one should not miss.

title: Main attraction in Rishikesh
review: This is the first attraction in Rishikesh usually visited by the tourist. It is a suspension bridge so you will have shaking feeling while you are on the bridge. A good crowd was always there all the day.

title: Watch out for the motorbikes!
review: This is one of the bridges In Rishikesh that spans the Ganges and allows people to get from one side to the other. Teeming with people it is a bird’s eye view of India with everyone going about their business, watch out for the motorbikes though!

title: Laxman Jhula Bridge
review: A must visit for all. Amazing view from top. We enjoyed our trip at Laxman Jhula Bridge. Preferably take a guide along.

title: The stronger bridge
review: The view of the river Ganga from this bridge, is really beautiful.  Through this bridges cross the river using bike, and even through walk.  The bridge swings gently when we climb on it.  there is another  same type of bridge namely, Ram Julha.

title: Suspension Bridge Well famous As Laxman Jhula
review: Visited this in may 2017. on the shore of Holy River Ganga it feels like Heaven. Clear milky water is too cold in summer also as it formed by melting of glacier .So many People enjoyed river rafting and other water sport in gaga river but some people like me were enjoyed  river bath in gaga and enjoyed surroundings. after that we walk through the suspension bridge famous as laxman jhula and go to otherside of river ganga to take darshan of temples on the other side.Must visit specially in summers

title: Excellent
review: This is most happening place during the day light in Rishikesh.  but we normally spend hours standing on Laxman jhula during night hours.  you can clearly hear Ganga maiya sound.  truly amazing..

title: Good
review: The  place  is  very  good .......... there  is  too  much  croud i  enjoyed  that  place  very  much  ........ thanx to my mother and farther

title: Feel like heaven
review: It is an exciting place to visit.

title: Laxman Jhula
review: If you want to have the first glimpse of the mighty River Ganga, then Laxman Jhula is the place where you need to be. You can feel the power of the River once you cross the bridge

title: Bridge over sacred water
review: Laxman Jhula is an amazing suspension bridge over the Ganga river. It is full of pilgrims monkeys cows scooters and sometimes horses or donkeys. Keep your valuables close to your body and take your sunglasses off of your head...the monkeys are skilled thieves!

title: Interesting walk along the Ganges
review: Like Ram Jhula we found it very touristy but interesting. We stopped at a German cafe overlooking the river, just enjoying the sight.

title: The most beautiful bridge
review: Opposite of Ram Jhulla bridge you find this amazing walking bridge that connects 2 banks on the Ganges

title: mesmerizing beauty the gem of uttrakhand
review: if u have been to haridwar u must go to rishikesh , mussorri and lansdown also ,

title: Crowd experience over the Ganges.
review: The bridge moves a bit !There are photographers with digital facility at both ends.

title: Times Square of Rishikesh !!!
review: Let me put this in another way... as any tourist who visits New York never misses to go to the Times Square, same is the scene here...

title: Good feelings while you walk on the Jhula
review: Full of excitement !! one you reach at the top of Jhula.It is an attraction for the yatris who visit Rishkesh.

title: Walk over the ganges!!
review: from the main road Laxan jhula is a good 15 minutes walk, u will pass the temple which has a 14tonne shivling and some good shacks and stores selling holy items. Expect a lot of monkeys on the jhula and welcoming you as well so pls do take care of personal items in your hand.  the walk over the ganges was a thrilling feeling.You can even watch the ganga aarti from the bridge instead of going right down to the temple.

title: Holy Bridge
review: Laxman Jhula, It's really inspiring Holy Bridge built on ropes. It might be one of the early rope bridge's in India or first generation rope bridges. The other long one is Ram Jhula also a rope bridge.

title: Bridge to faith
review: This is an exciting piece of attractions in rishikesh. all time favorite and attractive for tourists and locals alike. U get to feel the fresh mountaineous ganga air and through this you can reach swargashram side on foot.

title: Quiet Flows The Holy Ganges!
review: Leaving the mountains, the river  appeared serene and beautiful. It's banks carpeted with white sand and boulders of rocks carried by the swift current during the  torrid  summer months seemed enchanting! The rapids of upper Shivpuri gave away to a placid surface, small wirpools faded away swiftly, the winter Sun slowly melted the dews clinging to the leaves, a few seagulls flew over,  the hanging bridge of Muni Ki Reti over the horizon looked like the  mythical bow of Lord Rama. Standing  on the bank of  this  ancient river,  I  closed my eyes! The vision of  a brilliant sky  with whiffs of gentle clouds filled up my mind, the  majestic mountains standing quietly, cold  morning breeze rustling the  leaves,   the faint sound of the waves  crashing on the shore and  an echo of a sacred hymn floated across  the river bed. The  peace and the  tranquility of this holy land  struck a chord deep inside.  A sense of   timelessness and the eternal presence gradually engulfed you in a bliss. Life is beautiful. Random Musings. Muni Ki Reti, Rhishkesh.

title: The long  standing iron suspension bridge, Lakshman Jhula
review: This beautiful iron suspension bridge is across the mighty Ganga. It is about half -a-a-km in length. It is for pedestrians only. We can have an awesome view of the mighty Ganga river, about 60  feet below  from the bridge. It is nearly 90 years old. and is a must-see spot in Rishikesh. There are many temples near the bridge. The snan ghat is a lovely place. One can have a rejuvenating dip in the holy ganga peacefully.

title: Its the ancient one with beautiful view.
review: Ganges flowing looks very mesmerizing while standing on this bridge. 2 wheeler is allowed to cross the river as well.

title: Heritage Jhula of Rishikesh
review: Rishikesh and Laxmanjhula are inextricably linked. The hanging foot bridge joins the old and new part of the city over the ganges.

title: A cable stayed bridge with a good view of river below
review: Its a hanging bridge with steel ropes spanning across the river.

title: One of the Best attractions in Rishikesh
review: It's a well made foot bridge. 2 wheelers do travel on this hanging bridge along with passersby. At night it is well lit and very attractive. Has a lot of eat outs and cafes along side.

title: New experience
review: The Lakshman jhula is the best bridge of the Rishikesh which many people can hangout and reduce godfrey got fighters spirit of God.

title: Amazing view of Ganga River !
review: If you plan to discover the city of yoga, you have to cross the Ganga from the Laxman Jhula Bridge !

title: Historical value
review: Nothing exceptionally remarkable about the place. May be one time visit for historical reasons - that's all!

title: A must see
review: A perfect place to watch all the passing traffic go by wether its a colorful indian family, a honking motorbike, or a scrolling cow, the monkey seems to be the one keeping an eye on you.
